edu.duke

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.duke.Shape

  • public class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    The Shape class represents a collection of Points that can easily model a polygonal shape. Points can be added in order via code or given using a file, one point per line separated by a comma. The points can then be accessed in the order they were added one at a time, using the method getPoints.

    Example usage: 

     Point a = new Point(3, 4);
 Point b = new Point(2, 5);
 Shape s = new Shape();
 s.addPoint(a);
 s.addPoint(b);
 s.addPoint(new Point(1, 1));
 for (Point p : s.getPoints()) {
     System.out.println(p);
 }

    A Shape can also be created using file in the following format: 

     3, 4
 2, 5
 1, 1

    Example file usage: 

     FileResource fr = new FileResource();
 Shape s = new Shape(fr);
 for (Point p : s.getPoints()) {
     System.out.println(p);
 }

    This software is licensed with an Apache 2 license, see http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 for details.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shape()
      Create an empty Shape object, one with no points.
      Shape(FileResource file)
      Create a Shape object from a file with x,y coordinates of points, in order, one pair of x,y per line.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape

        public Shape()
        Create an empty Shape object, one with no points.

      • Shape

        public Shape(FileResource file)
        Create a Shape object from a file with x,y coordinates of points, in order, one pair of x,y per line. Each x,y are comma-separated, e.g., 
           3,4
  -2,5
        whitespace on line is skipped.
        Parameters:
        file - is the FileResource accessible and bound to a file with one pair of points per line

    • Method Detail

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(Point p)
        Add a point to this shape/polygon. The order in which points are added defines the order in which points are accessed.
        Parameters:
        p - is the Point added to this shape

      • getLastPoint

        public Point getLastPoint()
        Return the last point added to this shape/polygon
        Returns:
        the last Point added

      • getPoints

        public java.lang.Iterable<Point> getPoints()
        Allow access to this shape one point at a time.
        Returns:
        an Iterable that allows access to points
